summary: Email chain between an Assistant United States Attorney and a NYPD/FBI detective regarding the transfer of evidence (boots and two hard drives containing confidential images) to Colorado for review by Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorneys. The evidence is being sent to the Denver FBI field office.

persons.name: Iii P.
persons.role: Person originally handling evidence transfer task
persons.context: Mentioned as being out for the week, with the email sender taking over the evidence transfer task.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The evidence (boots and hard drives) is being transferred to Colorado for review by her defense attorneys.

connections.description: Iii P. was originally tasked with handling evidence transfer for Maxwell's defense, indicating a procedural connection in the legal case.

events.title: Evidence transfer coordination
events.description: Email correspondence coordinating the transfer of physical evidence (boots) and digital evidence (two hard drives with confidential images) from New York to the Denver FBI field office for review by Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.

locations: Southern District of New York, St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Evidence in the Ghislaine Maxwell case included boots and two hard drives containing highly confidential images.
The evidence was being transferred from New York to the Denver FBI field office in Colorado for review by Maxwell's defense attorneys.
The transfer was coordinated by an Assistant United States Attorney and a NYPD/FBI detective on the Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force.
The email chain demonstrates ongoing legal proceedings and evidence handling in Maxwell's case as of August 2021.
